other_tests.findings: Black-speckled changes throughout the entire colonic mucosa; mild inflammation of the intestinal mucosa with aggregation of tissue cells that phagocytose pigments in the lamina propria; colon lesion consistent with changes in colonic melanosis.
Pathological results indicated mild inflammation of the intestinal mucosa; no crypt deformation or non-caseating granuloma was observed.
Pathological results indicated perianal mucinous adenocarcinoma.
